examples: Sure you muſt have obſerved the drop of the under lip is exploded ſince Lady Simpermode broke a tooth—(Sets her mouth affectedly)—I am preparing the caſt of the lips for the enſuing winter—thus—It is to be call’d the Paphian mimp.

verbs.description: mimp (third-person singular simple present mimps, present participle mimping, simple past and past participle mimped)

examples: The Beaux alter’d Creatures,Now mimp up their Features,And trip it, and trip it ſo pretty; […]

entries.meaning: To act in an affectedly prim or dainty manner.
